text:
Grayscale images are interpreted with a *linear* ICC profile;
this causes them to appear significantly lighter than when
viewed in the Adobe SVG Viewer, which seems to assume a
gamma of 2.2 or an sRGB-like encoding of the grayscale values,
which makes sense since this is also what is assumed for
color images.


The other problem is that specifying a gray ICC profile
on a grayscale image causes an error:

Input image and associated color profile have mismatching
number of color components: conversion is not possible

This is because the image gets converted to RGB before the
ICC profile is applied.
creator: fpahl@web.de
deweese@apache.org
text:
Can you provide sample content as an attachment?
Preferably for both problems?

creator: deweese@apache.org

Reassigning all open bugs to the development list.
